article.title: Danny_Kaye
article.paragraph: Danny Kaye(bornDavid Daniel Kaminsky; January 18, 1911  March 3, 1987) was an American actor, singer, dancer, and comedian. His performances featuredphysical comedy, idiosyncraticpantomimes, and rapid-fireNovelty songnovelty songs.

Kaye starred in 17 movies, notablyWonder Man (film)Wonder Man(1945),The Kid from Brooklyn(1946),The Secret Life of Walter Mitty (1947 film)The Secret Life of Walter Mitty(1947),The Inspector General (film)The Inspector General(1949),Hans Christian Andersen (film)Hans Christian Andersen(1952),White Christmas (film)White Christmas(1954), andThe Court Jester(1956). His films were popular, especially his bravura performances of patter songs and favorites such as "Inchworm (song)Inchworm" and "The Ugly Duckling". He was the first ambassador-at-large ofUNICEFin 1954 and received theLegion of HonourFrench Legion of Honorin 1986 for his years of work with the organization.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idFrench Honor Danny Kaye26 February 1986The Modesto Bee18 January 2011
article.heading: Early years
article.paragraph: David Daniel Kaminskywas born toUkrainiansUkrainianJewishimmigrants inBrooklynon January 18, 1911 (though he would later say 1913).Dena Kaye interview on TCM January 18, 2013. Her father was actually born in 1911 but, for reasons unknown to her, changed it to 1913. FBI records andSSDIalso show 1911.Cite webhttp://www.legacy.com/ns/obitfinder/ssdi-search.aspx?daterange1980-1989 Obituaries [SSDI search]March 23, 2014Legacy.com/[[SSDI]]Kaye was born the youngest of three boys for Jacob and Clara Nemerovsky Kaminsky. Jacob and Clara and their two sons, Larry and Mac, leftDnipropetrovskYekaterinoslavtwo years before his birth; he was the only son born in the United States.cite bookhttp://books.google.com/books?idThe Great Clowns of American TelevisionAdirKarenMcFarland & Company20012700-7864-1303-4January 18, 2011

He attended Public School 149 inEast New York, Brooklynwhich eventually was renamed to honor himcite webWelcome P.S. 149 Danny Kayehttp://schools.nyc.gov/schoolportals/19/k149/default.htmNY City Dept of Education8 January 2013where he began entertaining his classmates with songs and jokes,cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idWorld-renown comedian diesMarch 4, 1987Eugene Register-GuardDecember 15, 2010before moving toThomas Jefferson High School (Brooklyn, New York)Thomas Jefferson High School, though he never graduated.

His mother died when he was in his early teens. Not long after his mother's death, Kaye and his friend Louis ran away to Florida. Kaye sang while Louis played the guitar; the pair eked out a living for a while. When Kaye returned to New York, his father did not pressure him to return to school or work, giving his son the chance to mature and discover his own abilities.Kaye said that as a young boy he had wanted to be a surgeon, but there was no chance of the family affording a medical school education.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idMrs. Danny Kaye Proves a GeniusBattelle, PhyllisMay 8, 1959The Milwaukee SentinelMarch 10, 2011

He held a succession of jobs after leaving school, as asoda jerk, insurance investigator, and office clerk. Most ended with his being fired. He lost the insurance job when he made an error that cost the insurance company $40,000. The dentist who hired him to look after his office at lunch hour did the same when he found Kaye using hisDental drilldrillon the office woodwork.cite webhttp://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,776720-1,00.htmlGit Gat GittleMarch 11, 1946Time.comJanuary 14, 2011He learned his trade in his teenage years in theCatskill MountainsCatskillsas atummlerin theBorscht Belt.

Kaye's first break came in 1933 when he joined the "Threewikt:terpsichoreanTerpsichoreans", a vaudeville dance act. They opened inUtica, New York, where he used the nameDanny Kayefor the first time.The act toured the United States, then performed inAsiawith the showLa Vie Paree.The troupe left for a six-month tour of theFar Easton February 8, 1934. While they were inOsaka,Japan, atyphoonhit the city. The hotel where Kaye and his colleagues stayed suffered heavy damage; a piece of the hotel'scornicewas hurled into Kaye's room by the strong wind, nearly killing him. By performance time that evening, the city was in the grip of the storm. There was no power, and the audience was restless and nervous. To calm them, Kaye went on stage, holding a flashlight to illuminate his face, and sang every song he could recall as loudly as he was able.The experience of trying to entertain audiences who did not speak English inspired him to the pantomime, gestures, songs, and facial expressions that eventually made his reputation.Sometimes he found pantomime necessary when ordering a meal. Kaye's daughter, Dena, tells a story her father related about being in a restaurant in China and trying to order chicken. Kaye flapped his arms and clucked, giving the waiter an imitation of a chicken. The waiter nodded in understanding, bringing Kaye two eggs. His interest in cooking began on the tour.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idLife With My Zany Father-Danny KayeKaye, DenaJanuary 19, 1969Tri City HeraldJanuary 15, 2011

When Kaye returned to the United States, jobs were in short supply and he struggled for bookings. One job was working in a burlesque revue withfan dancerSally Rand. After the dancer dropped a fan while trying to chase away a fly, Kaye was hired to watch the fans so they were always held in front of her.
article.heading: Career
article.paragraph: File:Hans Christian Andersen FilmPoster.jpegthumbright200pxFilm poster 1952Danny Kaye made his film debut in a 1935 comedyShort subjectshortMoon Over Manhattan. In 1937 he signed with New YorkbasedEducational Picturesfor a series of two-reel comedies. Kaye usually played a manic, dark-haired, fast-talking Russian in these low-budget shorts, opposite young hopefulsJune AllysonorImogene Coca. The Kaye series ended abruptly when the studio shut down in 1938. He was working in the Catskills in 1937 under the nameDanny Kolbin.cite webhttp://www.loc.gov/exhibits/bobhope/images/vc53ap1.jpg"Highlights and Shadows"-front of programJuly 4, 1937The President PlayersFebruary 25, 2011cite webhttp://www.loc.gov/exhibits/bobhope/images/vc53ap2.jpg"Highlights and Shadows" - inside of programJuly 4, 1937The President PlayersFebruary 25, 2011

His next venture was a short-lived Broadway show, withSylvia Fineas the pianist, lyricist and composer. TheStraw Hat Revueopened on September 29, 1939, and closed after ten weeks, but critics took notice of Kaye's work.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idWho Is Sylvia?October 30, 1960Pittsburgh Post-GazetteJanuary 18, 2011The reviews brought an offer for both Kaye and his bride, Sylvia, to work atLa Martinique, a New York City nightclub. Kaye performed with Sylvia as his accompanist. At La Martinique, playwrightMoss Hartsaw Danny perform, which led to Hart casting him in his hitBroadway theatreBroadwaycomedyLady in the Dark.

Kaye scored a triumph at age 30 in 1941, playing Russell Paxton inLady in the Dark, starringGertrude Lawrence. His show-stopping number was "Tchaikovsky (song)Tchaikovsky", byKurt WeillandIra Gershwin, in which he sang the names of a string ofRussiancomposers at breakneck speed, seemingly without taking a breath.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idDanny Kaye: King of ComedyRemingtonFredJanuary 12, 1964The Pittsburgh PressMarch 10, 2011In the next Broadway season, he was the star of a show about a young man who is drafted, calledLet's Face It!.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idDanny Kaye as Musical Draftee Brightens the Broadway SceneEdelLeonNovember 8, 1941January 19, 2011

His feature film debut was in producerSamuel Goldwyn'sTechnicolor1944 comedyUp in Arms,''Up In Arms''at theInternet Movie Databasea remake of Goldwyn'sEddie CantorcomedyWhoopee! (film)Whoopee!(1930).cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idDanny Kaye Makes Successful Debut in 'Up In Arms'May 20, 1944WhittakerHerbertThe Montreal GazetteJanuary 22, 2011Kaye's rubber face and patter were a hit,Citation neededSeptember 2010and rival producer Robert M. Savini cashed in by compiling three of Kaye's Educational Pictures shorts into a patchwork feature,The Birth of a Star(1945).cite webhttp://www.imdb.com/title/tt0218051The Birth of a StarInternet Movie DatabaseJanuary 19, 2011Studio mogul Goldwyn wanted Kaye's prominent nose fixed to look less Jewish,cite bookKanferStefanA summer world: the attempt to build a Jewish Eden in the Catskills from the days of the ghetto to the rise and decline of the Borscht Belt1989Farrar, Straus & GirouxNew York978-03742718001571stKaye refused but did allow his red hair to be dyed blonde, apparently because it looked better in Technicolor.cite webNolanJ. LeighDanny! Danny Kate F.A.Q.shttp://www.dannykaye.net/dkfaq.htm#hairJ. Leigh NolanJanuary 8, 2013

Kaye starred in a radio program,The Danny Kaye Show, onCBSin 194546.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idHelen and Danny: O-Kaye! Crowd HowlsFebruary 2, 1946Foley, Roy L.The Milwaukee SentinelJanuary 14, 2011

File:Bing Crosby and Danny Kaye in White Christmas trailer.jpgthumbleft250px''White Christmas (film)White Christmas'' trailerThe program's popularity rose quickly. Before a year, he tied withJimmy Durantefor fifth place in theRadio Dailypopularity poll.Kaye was asked to participate in aUSOtour following the end ofWorld War II. It meant that he would be absent from his radio show for nearly two months at the beginning of the season. Kaye's friends filled in, with a different guest host each week.cite webhttp://www.digitaldeliftp.com/DigitalDeliToo/dd2jb-Danny-Kaye-Show.htmlDanny KayeDigitalDeliJanuary 14, 2011Kaye was the first American actor to visit postwar Tokyo. He had toured there some ten years before with the vaudeville troupe.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idRiding the AirwavesBCLNovember 12, 1945The Milwaukee JournalJanuary 14, 2011cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idLily Pons the Guest Star Tonight Of Danny Kaye, Back From TourNovember 23, 1945The Montreal GazetteJanuary 15, 2011When Kaye asked to be released from his radio contract in mid-1946, he agreed not to accept a regular radio show for one year and only limited guest appearances on other radio programs.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idMannersDanny Kaye released from his radio contractThe Milwaukee SentinelMay 3, 1946Dorothy MannersJanuary 14, 2011Many of the show's episodes survive today, notable for Kaye's opening "signature" patter ("Git gat gittle, giddle-di-ap, giddle-de-tommy, riddle de biddle de roop, da-reep, fa-san, skeedle de woo-da, fiddle de wada, reep!").

Kaye starred in several movies with actressVirginia Mayoin the 1940s, and is known for films such asThe Secret Life of Walter Mitty (1947 film)The Secret Life of Walter Mitty(1947),The Inspector General (film)The Inspector General(1949),On the Riviera(1951) co-starringGene Tierney,Knock on Wood (1954 film)Knock on Wood(1954),White Christmas (film)White Christmas(1954, in a role intended forFred Astaire, thenDonald O'Connor),The Court Jester(1956), andMerry Andrew (film)Merry Andrew(1958). Kaye starred in two pictures based on biographies,Hans Christian Andersen (film)Hans Christian Andersen(1952) theDenmarkDanishstory-teller, andThe Five Pennies(1959) aboutjazzpioneerRed Nichols. His wife, writer/lyricist Sylvia Fine, wrote many tongue-twisting songs for which Kaye became famous.She was an associate producer.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idDanny Kaye Film Set at WarnersBrady, Thomas F.November 13, 1947The Montreal GazetteJanuary 18, 2011Some of Kaye's films included the theme of doubles, two people who look identical (both Danny Kaye) being mistaken for each other, to comic effect.citation neededMarch 2015

Kaye teamed with the popularAndrews Sisters(Patty, Maxene, and LaVerne) on Decca Records in 1947, producing the number-three Billboard smash hit "Civilization (1947 song)Civilization (Bongo, Bongo, Bongo)". The success of the pairing prompted both acts to record through 1950, producing several hits, including "Woody Woodpecker#"The Woody Woodpecker Song"The Woody Woodpecker Song".Image:Danny Kaye ww2 45.jpgthumbright220pxDanny Kaye on USO tour at Sasebo, Japan, October 25, 1945. Kaye and his friend, Dodgers manager Leo Durocher, made the trip.While his wife wrote Kaye's material, there was much that was unwritten, springing from the mind of Danny Kaye, often while performing. Kaye had one character he never shared with the public; Kaplan, the owner of anAkron, Ohiorubber company, came to life only for family and friends. His wife Sylvia described the Kaplan character:cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idIt Happened Last NightWilsonEarlJuly 4, 1959Sarasota Herald-TribuneJanuary 18, 2011He doesn't have any first name. Even his wife calls him just Kaplan. He's an illiterate pompous character who advertises his philanthropies. Jack Benny or Dore Schary might say, "Kaplan, why do you hate unions so?" If Danny feels like doing Kaplan that night, he might be off on Kaplan for two hours.

When he appeared at theLondon Palladiumin 1948, he "roused the Royal family to laughter and was the first of many performers who have turned British variety into an American preserve."Life (magazine)Lifemagazine described his reception as "worshipful hysteria" and noted that the royal family, for the first time, left theroyal boxto watch from the front row of the orchestra.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idKaye: everyone's favouriteYoung, AndrewMarch 4, 1987The Glasgow HeraldDecember 15, 2010cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idDanny Kaye Won't Talk of RoyaltyJanuzzi, GeneOctober 23, 1949Pittsburgh Post-GazetteJanuary 15, 2011cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idDanny Kaye Is a Real ShowoffHandsaker, GeneOctober 11, 1948Kentucky New EraMarch 12, 2011He related that he had no idea of the familial connections when theGeorge Mountbatten, 2nd Marquess of Milford HavenMarquess of Milford Havenintroduced himself after a show and said he would like his cousins to see Kaye perform.Kaye stated he never returned to the venue because there was no way to recreate the magic of that time.cite webhttp://www.nydailynews.com/archives/entertainment/1996/12/10/1996-12-10_the_many_lives_of_danny_kaye.htmlThe Many Lives of Danny KayeBianculli, DavidDecember 10, 1996New York Daily NewsMarch 10, 2011Kaye had an invitation to return to London for aRoyal Variety Performancein November of the same year.cite webhttp://www.eabf.org.uk/royal-variety-performance/archive/1940s/1948Royal Variety Performance1948Entertainment Artistes Benenevolent FundJanuary 22, 2011When the invitation arrived, Kaye was busy withThe Inspector General(which had a working title ofHappy Times). Warners stopped the film to allow their star to attend.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idRoyal Invitation for Danny KayeOctober 20, 1948The Montreal GazetteJanuary 22, 2011When his Decca co-workersthe Andrews Sistersbegan their engagement at the London Palladium on the heels of Kaye's successful 1948 appearance there, the trio was well received andDavid Lewinof theDaily Expressdeclared, "The audience gave the Andrews Sisters the Danny Kaye roar!"

He hosted the24th Academy Awardsin 1952. The program was broadcast on radio. Telecasts of the Oscar ceremony came later. During the 1950s, Kaye visitedAustralia, where he played "Buttons (pantomime)Buttons" in a production ofCinderellainSydney. In 1953, Kaye started a production company, Dena Pictures, named for his daughter.Knock on Woodwas the first film produced by his firm. The firm expanded into television in 1960 under the name Belmont Television.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idFriday Film Notes-Danny--ProducerGoldieTomJuly 10, 1953Evening TimesMarch 10, 2011cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idDanny Kaye Founds Film FirmDecember 6, 1960The Pittsburgh PressMarch 10, 2011

Kaye entered television in 1956 on the CBS showSee It NowwithEdward R. Murrow.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idFound at Last: A Happy ComedianMcManus, MargaretSeptember 23, 1956The Milwaukee JournalMarch 10, 2011The Secret Life of Danny Kayecombined his 50,000-mile, ten-country tour as UNICEF ambassador with music and humor.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idDanny Kaye Gives TV Its Finest 90 MinutesMercer, Charles5 December 1956The Miami News19 January 2011cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idColor Shows, Danny Kaye, Draw AttentionPearson, HowardDecember 3, 1956The Deseret NewsJanuary 19, 2011His first solo effort was in 1960 with an hour special produced by Sylvia and sponsored byGeneral Motors; with similar specials in 1961 and 1962.

File:Danny Kaye portrait.jpgthumbleft220pxKaye in 1955He hosted a variety hour onCBStelevision,The Danny Kaye Show, from 196367, which won fourEmmy awardsand aPeabody award.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idDanny Kaye always excelled as an entertainer and in lifeDrewMikeMarch 4, 1987The Milwaukee JournalDecember 15, 2010cite webhttp://www.mateas.com/DannyKaye/TV1963Season.htmThe Danny Kaye Episode GuideMateas Media Consulting2 February 2011

Beginning in 1964, he acted as television host to the CBS telecasts ofMetro-Goldwyn-MayerMGM'sThe Wizard of Oz (1939 film)The Wizard of Oz. Kaye did a stint as aWhat's My Line?Mystery Guest on the Sunday night CBS-TV quiz program. Kaye was later a guest panelist on that show. He also appeared on theNBCinterview programHere's Hollywood. In the 1970s, Kaye tore a ligament in his leg in the run of theRichard Rodgersmusical,Two by Two (musical)Two by Two, but went on with the show, appearing with his leg in a cast and cavorting on stage in a wheelchair.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idReal people go to matinees and Danny Kaye loves 'emRaidyWilliam A.February 17, 1971The Montreal GazetteJanuary 19, 2011He had done much the same on his television show in 1964 when his right leg and foot were burned from a cooking accident. Camera shots were planned so television viewers did not see Kaye in his wheelchair.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idAccident Confines Danny Kaye to ChairLowryCynthiaApril 17, 1964Eugene Register-GuardJanuary 15, 2011

In 1976, he playedMister Geppettoin a television musical adaptation ofThe Adventures of PinocchiowithSandy Duncanin the title role. Kaye portrayed Captain Hook opposite Mia Farrow in aPeter Pan (1976 musical)musical version of ''Peter Pan''featuring songs byAnthony NewleyandLeslie Bricusse. It was shown onNBC-TVin December 1976, theHallmark Hall of Fameseries. He later guest-starred in episodes ofThe Muppet Show,The Cosby Showand in the 1980s revival ofThe Twilight ZoneNew Twilight Zone.

In many films, as well as on stage, Kaye proved to be an able actor, singer, dancer and comedian. He showed his serious side as Ambassador forUNICEFand in his dramatic role in the memorable TV filmSkokie (film)Skokie,when he played aHolocaustsurvivor.Before his death in 1987, Kaye conducted an orchestra during a comical series of concerts organized for UNICEF fundraising. Kaye received twoAcademy Awards: anAcademy Honorary Awardin 1955 andthe Jean Hersholt Humanitarian Awardin 1982. That year he also received theScreen Actors GuildAnnual Award.

In 1980, Kaye hosted and sang in the 25th Anniversary ofDisneyland Park (Anaheim)Disneylandcelebration, and hosted the opening celebration forEpcotin 1982 (EPCOT Center at the time), both were aired on prime time television in the U.S.citation neededMarch 2015
article.heading: Career in music
article.paragraph: File:DaveKapp-DannyKaye-1947.JPGthumbrightDavid Kapp and Danny Kaye, Decca recording studio, 1947Kaye was enamored of music. While he claimed an inability to read music, he was said to haveperfect pitch. A flamboyant performer with his own distinctive style, "easily adapting from outrageous novelty songs to tender ballads" (according to critic Jason Ankeny), in 1945 Kaye began hosting his own CBS radio program, launching a number of hit songs, including "Dinah" and "Minnie the Moocher".cite webJason Ankenyhttp://www.allmusic.com/artist/danny-kaye-mn0000029750/biographyDanny Kaye biography atAllmusic2015-01-13

In 1947 Kaye teamed with the popularAndrews Sisters(Patty, Maxene, and LaVerne) on Decca Records, producing the number-three Billboard hit "Civilization (Bongo, Bongo, Bongo)". The success of the pairing prompted both acts to record through 1950, producing rhythmically comical fare as "Woody Woodpecker#"The Woody Woodpecker Song"The Woody Woodpecker Song" (based on the bird from theWalter Lantzcartoons, and aBillboardhit for the quartet), "Put 'em in a Box, Tie 'em with a Ribbon (And Throw 'em in the Deep Blue Sea)", "The Big Brass Band from Brazil", "It's a Quiet Town (In Crossbone County)", "Amelia Cordelia McHugh (Mc Who?)", "Ching-a-ra-sa-sa", and a duet by Danny and Patty Andrews of "Orange Colored Sky". The acts teamed for two yuletide favorites: a frantic, harmonic rendition of "A Merry Christmas at Grandmother's House (Over the River and Through the Woods)", and a duet by Danny & Patty, "All I Want for Christmas Is My Two Front Teeth".Sforza, John:Swing It! The Andrews Sisters Story. University Press of Kentucky, 2000.

Kaye's self-titled debut album was released in 1949 by Columbia Records, with songs performed to the accompaniment ofMaurice AbravanelandJohnny Green. The album, described by the critic Bruce Eder as "a bit tamer than some of the stuff that Kaye hit with later in the '40s and in the '50s", failed to attract "nearly the interest of his kid's records and overt comedy routines."cite webBruce Ederhttp://www.allmusic.com/album/danny-kaye-mw0001447249Danny Kaye 1949 album reviewAllMusic2015-01-13

1950 saw the release of a single "I've Got a Lovely Bunch of Coconuts", his sole big U.S. chart hit,and the second albumDanny Kaye Entertains(1950, Columbia), a more diverse collection, with Kaye going through a set of that made him famous on the radio and in his early movies; most notably "Tchaikowsky".cite webBruce Ederhttp://www.allmusic.com/album/danny-kaye-entertains-mw0001452035Danny Kaye Entertains record reviewAllmusic2015-01-13Following the success of the filmHans Christian Andersen(1952), two of its songs, written byFrank Loesserand sung by Kaye, "The Ugly Duckling" and "Wonderful Copenhagen", reached the Top Five on the U.K. pop charts.

In 1953, Decca releasedDanny at the Palace, a live recording made at the New York Palace Theater,cite webhttp://www.discogs.com/Danny-Kaye-Danny-At-The-Palace/master/471611Danny at the PalaceDiscogs2015-01-13followed byKnock On Wood(Decca, 1954) a set of songs from the movie of the same name sung by Kaye, accompanied byVictor YoungVictor Young and His Singing Strings.cite webhttp://www.discogs.com/Danny-Kaye-Knock-On-Wood/release/5289812Knock on Wood OSTDiscogs2015-01-13File:Danny Kaye-Nancy Wilson - 1965.JPGthumbleft200pxSingerNancy Wilson (jazz singer)Nancy Wilsonappearing on his show in 1965In 1956, Kaye signed a three-year recording contract withCapitol Recordswhich released his single "Love Me Do" in December of that year.Love Me Do/Ciu Ciu Bella. Record details @ 45catThe B-side, "Ciu Ciu Bella", lyrics written by Sylvia Fine, was inspired by an episode inRomewhen Kaye, on a mission for theUNICEF, befriended a seven-year-oldpoliovictim in a children's hospital who sang this song for him in Italian."Kaye Signs 3-Year Pact With Capitol", Billboard Magazine, December 15, 1956, p. 30

In 1958,Saul ChaplinandJohnny Mercerwrote songs forMerry Andrew, a film starring Kaye as a British teacher attracted to the circus. The score added up to six numbers, all sung by Kaye; conductor Billy May's 1950 composition "Bozo's Circus Band" (renamed "Music of the Big Top Circus Band") was deposited on the second side of the Merry Andrew soundtrack, released in 1958.cite webWilliam Ruhlmannhttp://www.allmusic.com/album/merry-andrew-original-soundtrack-mw0000417149Merry Andrew soundtrackAllmusic2015-01-13A year later another soundtrack came out,The Five Pennies(Kaye starred there as 1920s cornet player Loring Red Nichols), featuringLouis Armstrong.cite webhttp://www.discogs.com/Danny-Kaye-2-Louis-Armstrong-The-Five-Pennies/master/143201The Five PenniesDiscogs2015-01-13

In the 1960s and 1970s Kaye hosted his own television variety program and had enormous success on Broadway (The Madwoman of Challiot, 1969;Two by Two, 1970). He couldn't read a note of music, learning the scores by ear, but regularly conducted world-famous orchestras.cite webhttp://dannykaye.com/bioDanny Kaye official biography2015-01-13Kaye's style, even if accompanied by unpredictable antics (he once traded the baton for a fly swatter to conduct "The Flight of the Bumblebee")was praised by the likes ofZubin Mehtawho once stated that Kaye "has a very efficient conducting style."His ability with an orchestra was mentioned byDimitri Mitropoulos, then conductor of theNew York Philharmonic Orchestra. After Kaye's appearance, Mitropoulos remarked, "Here is a man who is not musically trained, who cannot even read music, and he gets more out of my orchestra than I have."cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idA Conversation With Danny KayeGoodmanMarkDecember 23, 1979Lakeland LedgerMarch 10, 2011Kaye was invited to conduct symphonies as charity fundraisersand was the conductor of the all-city marching band at the season opener of theLos Angeles Dodgersin 1984. Over his career he raised over US $5,000,000 in support of musician pension funds.cite webBiography of Danny KayeThe Kennedy Centerhttp://www.kennedy-center.org/calendar/index.cfm?fuseactionMay 14, 2008March 28, 2015
article.heading: Imitations
article.paragraph: unreferenced sectionMarch 2015Kaye was sufficiently popular to inspire imitations:

list.listitem: The 1946Warner Bros.cartoonBook Revuehad a sequence withDaffy Duckimpersonating Kaye singing "Carolina in the Morning" with the Russian accent that Kaye affected from time to time.

Satirical songwriterTom Lehrer's 1953 song "Lobachevsky (song)Lobachevsky" was based on a number that Kaye had done, about the Russian directorConstantin Stanislavski, with the affected Russian accent. Lehrer mentioned Kaye in an opening monologue, citing him as an "idol since childbirth".
SupermancreatorsJerry SiegelandJoe Shusterfashioned a short-lived superhero title,Funnyman (comics)Funnyman, taking inspiration from Kaye's persona.

article.heading: Other projects
Cooking
article.paragraph: In his later years he entertained at home as chefhe had a special stove on his patio and specialized in Chinese and Italian cooking.The stove Kaye used for his Chinese dishes was fitted with metal rings for the burners to allow the heat to be highly concentrated. Kaye installed a trough with circulating ice water to use the burners.cite webhttp://today.msnbc.msn.com/id/27054074Marcella Hazan: Memoir of a classic Italian chefOctober 7, 2008today.msnbc.msn.comMarch 10, 2011Kaye taught Chinese cooking classes at a San Francisco Chinese restaurant in the 1970s.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idDanny Kaye Teaches Chinese CookingJanuary 22, 1974Tri City HeraldJanuary 15, 2011The theater and demonstration kitchen under the library at theCulinary Institute of AmericainHyde Park, New Yorkis named for him.cite bookCooking secrets of the CIACulinary Institute of AmericaChronicle Books19951310-8118-1163-8http://books.google.com/booksidJanuary 18, 2011

Kaye referred to his kitchen as "Ying's Thing". While filmingThe Madwoman of Chaillotin France, he phoned home to ask his family if they would like to eat at "Ying's Thing" that evening; Kaye flew home for dinner.Not all of his efforts in the kitchen went well. After flying to San Francisco for a recipe for sourdough bread, he came home and spent hours preparing loaves. When his daughter asked about the bread, Kaye hit the bread on the kitchen table. His bread was hard enough to chip it.Kaye approached his kitchen work with enthusiasm, making sausages and other foods needed for his cuisine.His work as a chef earned him the ":fr:Meilleur ouvrier de FranceLes Meilleurs Ouvriers de France" culinary award. Kaye is the only non-professional chef to achieve this honor.
article.heading: Flying
article.paragraph: Kaye was an aviation enthusiast. He became interested in learning to aviate in 1959. An enthusiastic and accomplished golfer, he gave up golf in favor of flying.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idKaye Likes AirScottVernonJuly 14, 1962The Windsor StarMarch 18, 2011When Kaye went for his written pilot's exam, he brought aliverwurstsandwich in case he was there for hours. The first plane Kaye owned was aPiper PA-23Piper Aztec.cite bookhttp://books.google.com/books?idIf I Can Fly, You Can FlyKayeDannyJanuary 1967Popular ScienceMarch 11, 2011cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idDanny Kaye Likes Flying, TV, DodgersThomasBobSeptember 21, 1965Gettysburg TimesJanuary 15, 2011Kaye received his first license as a private pilot of multi-engine aircraft, not being certified for operating a single-engine plane until six years later.He was an accomplished pilot, rated for airplanes ranging from single-engine light aircraft to multi-engine jets.Kaye held a commercial pilot's license and had flown every type of aircraft except military planes.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idAmerican League's a new act for Danny KayeSmithRedThe Miami NewsJune 12, 1976January 21, 2011A vice-president ofLearjet, he owned and operated aLearjet 24.He supported many flying projects. In 1968, he was Honorary Chairman of the Las Vegas International Exposition of Flight, a show that utilized many facets of the citys entertainment industry while presenting an air show. The operational show chairman was well-known aviation figureLynn Garrison. Kaye flew his plane to 65 cities in five days on a mission to help UNICEF.

Danny Kaye was fond of the legendaryarrangementarrangerVic Schoen.Vic SchoenSchoenhad arranged for him onWhite Christmas (film)White Christmas,The Court Jester, and albums and concerts with theAndrews Sisters. In the 1960s, Schoen was working on a show in Las Vegas withShirley Temple. He was injured in a car accident. When Danny Kaye heard about the accident, he flew toMcCarran Airportto pick up Schoen and bring him toLos Angelesfor medical attention.citation neededApril 2014
article.heading: Baseball
article.paragraph: Kaye was part-owner of baseball'sSeattle Marinerswith Lester Smith from 197781.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idMajor League Baseball Returns To SeattleFebruary 9, 1976The Leader-PostJanuary 15, 2011Prior to that, the lifelong fan of theLos Angeles DodgersBrooklyn/Los Angeles Dodgersrecorded a song called "The D-O-D-G-E-R-S Song (Oh really? No, O'Malley!)", describing a fictitious encounter with theSan Francisco Giants, a hit during the real-life pennant chase of 1962. That song is included onBaseball's Greatest Hitscompact discs. A good friend ofLeo Durocher, he often traveled with the team.Kaye also possessed an encyclopedic knowledge of the game.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idDanny Kaye, comedian who loved children, dead at 74March 4, 1987Star-NewsDecember 15, 2010
article.heading: Medicine
article.paragraph: Kaye was an honorary member of theAmerican College of Surgeonsand theAmerican Academy of Pediatrics.
article.heading: Charity
article.paragraph: File:Amerikaanse filmacteur Danny Kaye arriveert op Schiphol.ogvthumbDanny Kaye on a promotion tour for UNICEF in the Netherlands, 1955Working alongsideUNICEF's Halloween fundraiser founder, Ward Simon Kimball Jr., the actor educated the public on impoverished children in deplorable living conditions overseas and assisted in the distribution of donated goods and funds. His involvement with UNICEF came about in an unusual way. Kaye was flying home from London in 1949 when one of the plane's four engines lost its propeller and caught fire. The problem was initially thought serious enough that it might make an ocean landing; life jackets and liferafts were made ready. The plane was able to head back over 500 miles to land atShannon Airport,Republic of IrelandIreland. On the way back to Shannon, the head of the Children's Fund,Maurice Pate, had the seat next to Danny Kaye and spoke at length about the need for recognition for the Fund. Their discussion continued on the flight from Shannon to New York; it was the beginning of the actor's long association with UNICEF.Cite webhttp://www.unicefusa.org/partners/ambassadors/danny-kaye/danny-kaye-bio.htmlDanny Kaye BiographyMarch 23, 2014[[UNICEF]]cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idCrippled Transport Limps to SafetyJuly 8, 1949The Lewiston Daily SunJanuary 19, 2011cite webhttp://www.unicef.org/people/people_danny_kaye.htmlDanny KayeUNICEFJanuary 19, 2011

"For all of his success as a performer... his greatest legacy remains his tireless humanitarian work - so close were his ties to the United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund (UNICEF) that when the organization received the Nobel Peace Prize, Kaye was tapped to accept it," according to music critic Jason Ankeny.
article.heading: Death
article.paragraph: Kaye died ofheart failureon March 3, 1987, aged 76, brought on by internal bleeding and complications ofhepatitis C.Kaye had quadruple bypass heart surgery in February 1983; he contracted hepatitis C from a blood transfusion.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idActor-comedian Danny Kaye diesMarch 3, 1987Pittsburgh Post-GazetteDecember 15, 2010He was survived by his wife and their daughter.His ashes are interred inKensico CemeteryinValhalla, New YorkValhalla, New York. His grave is adorned with a bench that containsfriezesof a baseball and bat, an aircraft, a piano, a flower pot, musical notes, and a chef'stoque. His name, birth and death dates are inscribed on the toque.cite webhttp://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?pagePhoto of Bench-Danny KayeFind a GraveNovember 27, 2010TheUnited Nationsheld a memorial tribute to him at their New York headquarters on the evening of October 21, 1987.cite webhttp://articles.latimes.com/1987-10-23/entertainment/ca-10800_1UN and Friends Pay Tribute to KayeOctober 23, 1987Taylor, ClarkeLA TimesJanuary 19, 2011cite webhttp://www.nytimes.com/1987/10/22/arts/un-praises-danny-kaye-at-tribute.htmlU.N. Praises Danny Kaye at TributeLewis, PaulOctober 22, 1987New York TimesMarch 18, 2011http://www.webcitation.org/5xHnXWIAmMarch 18, 2011
article.heading: Personal life
article.paragraph: File:Sylvia and Danny Kaye 1945.jpgthumbleft180pxKaye andSylvia Finegrew up in Brooklyn, living a few blocks apart, but they did not meet until they were working on an off-Broadway show in 1939.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idA team grew in BrooklynApril 25, 1975The DispatchMarch 10, 2011Sylvia was an audition pianist.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idComposer Sylvia Fine Can Write Anywhere AnytimeBoyle, HalAugust 27, 1959The Sunday News-PressNovember 27, 2010cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idKaye at the MetApril 25, 1975The Evening NewsNovember 27, 2010

Sylvia discovered that Danny had worked for her father Samuel Fine, a dentist.Kaye, working in Florida, proposed on the telephone; the couple were married inFort Lauderdalecite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idWho Is Sylvia? What Is She? – Danny Kaye's InspirationRaymer, DorothyNovember 6, 1945The Miami NewsJanuary 14, 2011on January 3, 1940.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idMovie producer, songwriter Sylvia Fine Kaye dies at 78October 29, 1991Daily NewsNovember 27, 2010cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idDanny Kaye To End TV Holdout; Wife To Write ScriptWilson, EarlJuly 4, 1959The Milwaukee SentinelJanuary 15, 2011Their daughter, Dena, was born on December 17, 1946.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idDanny Kaye Awaits Christmas Bulletin On Maternity FrontParsons, LouellaJuly 28, 1946The News and CourierJanuary 14, 2011

Kaye said in a 1954 interview, "Whatever she wants to be she will be without interference from her mother nor from me."cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idDanny Kaye Looks At LifePerry, LawrenceMay 9, 1954The Milwaukee JournalMarch 10, 2011cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idTravel writer attends party saluting hotelBoyd, Joseph G.May 23, 1980The Milwaukee SentinelMarch 10, 2011When she was very young, Dena did not like seeing her father perform because she did not understand that people were supposed to laugh at what he did.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idA Woman's New YorkHughes, AliceJanuary 28, 1953Reading EagleMarch 10, 2011

On 18 January 2013, during a 24-hour salute to Kaye onTurner Classic Moviesin celebration of what TCM thought was his 100th birthday, Kaye's daughter Dena revealed to TCM hostBen Mankiewiczthat Kaye's stated birth year of 1913 was incorrect, and that he was actually born in 1911.citation neededMarch 2015File:Danny Kaye 9 Allan Warren.jpgthumbright150pxKaye in 1986, byAllan WarrenAfter Kaye and his wife became estranged, circa 1947,cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idThe Secret Life of Danny KayeCheney, CarltonOctober 26, 1947The Milwaukee JournalJanuary 15, 2011cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idLike Peas In Pod Are Film Married DuosHandsaker, GeneDecember 11, 1947The Deseret NewsJanuary 18, 2011he was publicly seen partnered with a succession of women, although he and Fine never divorced.cite bookGottfriedMartinNobody's Fool: The Lives of Danny KayeNew York; LondonSimon & Schuster19940-671-86494-7cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idOpportunities Galore In Films For WomenThomas, BobJanuary 13, 1948Waycross Journal-HeraldJanuary 22, 2011cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idHollywood ReportMacPherson, VirginiaFebruary 9, 1948Oxnard Press-CourierJanuary 22, 2011cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idMovie Comedy Is Easy for Eve ArdenParsons, LouellaFebruary 21, 1948The Deseret NewsJanuary 19, 2011

Producer Perry Lafferty reported: "People would ask me, 'Is he gay? Is he gay?' I never saw anything to substantiate that in the time I was with him."Kaye's last girlfriend, Marlene Sorosky, reported that he told her, "I've never had a homosexual experience in my life. I've never had any kind of gay relationship. I've had opportunities, but I never did anything about them."
article.heading: Honors

link.target: File:DNK Order of Danebrog Knight 1st Degree BAR.png

list.listitem: Kaye was knighted by QueenMargrethe II of Denmarkon November 10, 1983. He was awarded the cross of theKnight of the Dannebrog, 1st Class, for his work with UNICEF and longstanding ties with Denmark. Kaye portrayedHans Christian Andersenin the 1952 film of the same name.cite newshttp://news.google.com/newspapers?nidKaye knightedThe Times-News, Hendersonville, North CarolinaNovember 10, 1983Copenhagen, DenmarkMarch 24, 2014
Chevalier of the FrenchLegion of Honoron February 24, 1986 for his work for UNICEF.

On June 23, 1987, Kaye was posthumously presented with thePresidential Medal of Freedomby PresidentRonald Reagan. The award was received by his daughter Dena.cite webhttp://articles.latimes.com/1987-04-22/news/mn-287_1Kaye, Willson to Get Medal of FreedomApril 22, 1987LA TimesJanuary 19, 2011cite webhttp://www.reagan.utexas.edu/archives/speeches/1987/062387j.htmRemarks at the Presentation Ceremony for the Presidential Medal of FreedomJune 23, 1987University of TexasMarch 10, 2011

article.heading: Awards and other recognition

list.listitem: Golden Globe Awardfor Best Actor Motion Picture Musical or Comedy 1951, forOn the Riviera
Golden Globe Award for Best Actor Motion Picture Musical or Comedy 1958, forMe and the Colonel
Lions Clubs InternationalHumanitarian Award (197374)
Jean Hersholt Humanitarian Award(1981)
Asteroid6546 Kaye

Three stars on theHollywood Walk of Fame; for his work in music, radio, and filmscite webhttp://projects.latimes.com/hollywood/star-walk/danny-kayeDanny Kaye-Hollywood Star WalkLos Angeles TimesJanuary 19, 2011
Kennedy Center Honor(1984)
Grand Marshal of theTournament of Roses Parade(1984)
The song "I Wish I Was Danny Kaye" onMiracle Legion's 1996 albumPortrait of a Damaged Family
UNICEF's New York Visitor's Centre is named to honor Danny Kaye.cite webhttp://www.unicef.org/virtualtourDanny Kaye Visitor's Centre Virtual TourUNICEFJanuary 19, 2011
In December 1996, thePublic Broadcasting ServicePBSseries,American Masters, aired a special on the life of Danny Kaye.

A street in theSan Antonio, Texas, neighborhood Oak Hills Terrace (located in the city's northwest) is named after Danny Kaye. The neighborhood was established in the late 1960s.citation neededMarch 2015

article.heading: Filmography

tablecell.extension: The 16 minute film,I Am an American, was featured in American theaters as a short feature in connection with "I Am an American Day" (now calledConstitution Day (United States)Constitution Day).I Am an Americanwas produced byGordon Hollingshead, also written byCrane Wilbur. See:tcmdb title730264I Am An AmericanandIMDb title0198551I Am an American.
